content.body: " In particular, a conforming implementation of ECMAScript may provide properties not described in this specification, and values for those properties, for objects that are described in this specification."
is it intentional that this doesn't bar shadowing properties like Error.prototype.toString
i think that in practice that loophole is way too wide
itâ€™s meant, i think, to allow nonstandard properties and globals, not to allow shadowing in that way
